title: 110_hr5523
content: The "Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008" establishes a license fee on internet gambling operators and requires licensee information reporting. This Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose the internet gambling license fee. The Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008 requires licensed internet gambling operators to pay a 2 percent license fee on all funds deposited into betting accounts each month. The fees collected are deposited into the Treasury's general fund as revenue and are the exclusive obligation of the operator. The Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008 mandates a 2 percent license fee on all funds deposited into betting accounts by licensed operators. The fees collected are deposited into the Treasury's general fund and are the operator's exclusive obligation. The term 'Director' is defined in section 5382 of title 31, United States Code, and the license fee is treated as an excise tax for administrative purposes. "SEC. 6039J. RETURNS OF INTERNET GAMBLING OPERATORS." Every Internet gambling operator subject to section 4491 must provide specified information to the Secretary, maintain appropriate records, and comply with regulations. This includes details such as the operator's information, customers' details, winnings, wagers, losses, tax withheld, and account balances. Every person required to make a return under subsection (a) must provide a written statement to each person listed in the return, including contact information and required return details. The statement must be given by January 31 of the following year. The table of sections for internet gambling operators is amended to include a new item. The amendments apply to wagers made after December 31, 2008. Additionally, withholding from certain gambling winnings is addressed in Section 3. The amendments to section 3402(q) address net internet gambling winnings over $5,000 in a calendar year, with no exemption for certain winnings. Definitions for "proceeds of net internet gambling winnings" are provided, including amounts withdrawn from an internet gambling account. The amendment addresses net internet gambling winnings over $5,000 in a calendar year, with definitions for "proceeds of net internet gambling winnings" and terms related to internet gambling operators and wagering. Backup withholding rules are also modified to include net internet gambling winnings as reportable payments. The amendment made by this section applies to wagers placed with a licensee after December 31, 2008. SEC. 4. WITHHOLDING OF TAX ON NONRESIDENT ALIENS. Tax on Nonresident Alien Individuals is amended to include net Internet gambling income. An exemption for certain gambling winnings now includes wagers placed over the Internet. Withholding of tax on nonresident aliens now includes proceeds of net Internet gambling winnings over $5,000 in a calendar year. The amendments made by this section apply to wagers over $5,000 placed with a licensee after December 31, 2008. SEC. 5. TAX ON WAGERS. Amended subsection requires persons placing wagers with unlicensed individuals to pay tax. Wagers made after December 31, 2008, within the US or its territories by US citizens/residents are subject to tax.
